subject: Weddings and Engagements
lead_paragraph: Tony Parker and Eva Longoria exchanged vows in a Paris cathedral that once served French royalty — stage two of a weekend wedding extravaganza that began with a civil ceremony and was to end last night at a storied French chateau.Guests at the service included Longoria’s “Desperate Housewives” co-stars Teri Hatcher, Nicolette Sheridan and Felicity Huffman. Ahead of the brief service on Saturday, Parker and Longoria married in a civil ceremony in Paris on Friday before a modest crowd of about 40 guests, including some of Parker’s San Antonio Spurs teammates and the French soccer player Thierry Henry.Parker, a 25-year-old who was born in Belgium and grew up in France, asked Paris Mayor Bertrand Delanoë to officiate. Parker’s friends translated when Delanoë gave a speech calling Parker a model in the fight against racism.Police cordons kept the public away from the cathedral, Saint-Germain-l’Auxerrois, which is across from the Louvre in Paris.
